subject: AI & Agents
title: Why AI Gets Fooled by Optical Illusions
description: One-minute skill: Why AI Gets Fooled by Optical Illusions.

hook.text: Add invisible noise to a photo of a stop sign and AI reads it as a speed limit sign.

buildup.text: Adversarial attacks exploit how neural networks process pixel patterns.

discovery.text: Tiny changes imperceptible to humans shift the math enough to flip the model's output.

twist.text: Researchers printed adversarial patches on T-shirts that made people invisible to cameras.

climax.text: This isn't just a lab trick â€” self-driving cars and security systems are vulnerable too.

punchline.text: If you know how it sees, you know how to blind it.

quiz.question: What is an adversarial attack on AI?
options: Tiny input changes that trick the model's output
A virus that destroys AI hardware
Overloading a model with too much data
